page.title: 09THE M9 MOTORWAY PLEAN/COWIE
page.content: The M9 motorway affected the area when it was opened. The Sauchenford smallholdings were divided in half by the motorway. The local people unsuccessfully objected to their community being split into two. A local service station lost trade selling petrol but has made a new business by recovering crashed and broken down vehicles on the motorway and now employs about 15 people. Building has commenced at the site of a farmhouse now demolished at the Pirnhall roundabout, and next year there will be a Motel, a restaurant and a filling station.
